TITLE: What Apes Can Teach Us About Our Heart Health
SUMMARY: If gorillas and chimpanzees were born to clamber and climb, humans were born to walk and run.

TITLE: Even a 20-Second Exercise ‘Snack’ Can Improve Fitness
SUMMARY: As little as 20 seconds of brisk stair climbing, done several times a day, might be enough to increase aerobic fitness.

TITLE: Are ‘Natural Flavors’ Really Natural?
SUMMARY: Food manufacturers add flavorings to a surprising number of basic products, like Breyers Natural Vanilla ice cream.

SUMMARY: A woman’s period can stop for a variety of reasons. Here is how you know it’s menopause.

TITLE: Weight Lifting to Fight Incontinence
SUMMARY: Can vaginal weights help to prevent pelvic floor disorders?

TITLE: Stopping the Anxiety of HPV
SUMMARY: A woman asks about finding emotional support after a diagnosis.

TITLE: How an Ice Bath May Undermine Your Weight Workout
SUMMARY: Cold water immersion is popular with some athletes, but it may slow the growth of new muscle.

TITLE: The Loneliness of Frontotemporal Dementia
SUMMARY: Since areas that dictate personality rather than memory are the first to suffer, people with the disease usually land on a therapist’s couch long before finding their way to a neurologist.

TITLE: Can I Ever Recover From Diverticulitis?
SUMMARY: Whether you have complications or a recurrence depends on the severity of your disease.

TITLE: Does Sunlight Through Glass Provide Vitamin D?
SUMMARY: You can’t get adequate UVB exposure sitting indoors or in a car.

TITLE: Catching Waves for Well-Being
SUMMARY: Surf therapy programs often focus on children with autism or anxiety, or groups like veterans or cancer survivors.

TITLE: Period. Stop.
SUMMARY: Is it a misconception that a woman needs to have a period for good health?

TITLE: How Walking Might Affect Our Sleep
SUMMARY: Among middle-aged men and women who took about 7,000 steps a day, covering even a little extra ground was tied to better sleep.

TITLE: Fiber in Fruits and Grains Protects Against Diverticulitis
SUMMARY: Our diets are overly refined. Eating more whole fruits, especially apples, pears and prunes, can help our digestive health.

TITLE: The Unbearable Heaviness of Clutter
SUMMARY: A cluttered home can be a stressful home, researchers are learning.
